en.title:
<size=52>MIGHTY CHIN CHIN</size>
and the
<size=40>Properties of Matter</size>
en.author: Written by: David Dionisio
en.restartDesc: Press CONFIRM to reset the level.
en.dragItemDesc: Drag the material into the world.
en.dragScreenDesc: Drag anywhere on the screen to move the view.
en.introDesc1:
Matter are things that have mass and volume. These are: solid, liquid, gas, plasma.

Press on any text for voice.
en.introDesc2:
Physical properties can be observed with your senses.

You can measure them with tools: weighing scale, beaker, thermometer.
en.introDesc3:
Chemical properties can only be observed once matter undergoes a change.

The resulting matter becomes completely different.
en.stage_desc_1: Size is a property of matter that determines how big or small something is. One such measurement is area, obtained by multiplying width and height.
en.stage_desc_2: Weight determines how heavy or light an object is relative to gravity. You can compare and determine a solid matter's weight by using a balance scale.
en.stage_desc_3: Buoyancy is the ability of an object to float in fluid or gas. The upward force exerted by the fluid allows the object to float.
en.stage_desc_4: Flammability (or combustibility) is a chemical reaction that causes a matter to ignite in flames. An example of a flammable matter is wood.
en.stage_desc_5: Conductivity is a property of matter that determines the ease of flow for electricity, heat, or sound. Metal is a great conduction for electricity.
en.stage_desc_6: With enough fuel and oxygen funneled into a chamber, the shear amount of combustion can create enough force to lift a heavy object into outer space.
en.launchChecklist1: Connect the Fuel Tank to a pump socket.
en.launchChecklist2: Connect the Oxidizer Tank to a pump socket.
en.launchChecklist3: Connect the Combustion Chamber to the pump tubes.
en.hintRevealDesc: Revealing this hint will cause you some points!
en.hint_stage_1_2_1:
Build a bridge to allow a passage across the treacherous spikes.

Build a stair to gain access to higher ground. Mighty Chin-Chin can jump over 3 stacks of blocks.
en.hint_stage_2_1_1: Make use of the balance scale as a make-shift stair.  Place heavy materials on one side, and lighter materials on the other.
en.hint_stage_2_2_1:
Use light materials as a platform to cross the first windy field.

Block the second windy field with heavy materials to avoid certain doom.
en.hint_stage_3_1_1:
Make use of materials that can float on water as a platform to cross.

Placing solid matter into liquid matter adds to its volume. Make use of this fact to allow a platform to float higher.
en.hint_stage_3_2_1:
Same as before: make use of materials that can float on water as a platform to cross.

Use materials that sink as a base support to reach higher ground.

Rubber has an elastic property that allows for powerful jumps.
en.hint_stage_4_1_1:
Iron has a good heat capacity to minimize the fiery temperature.

Place some iron blocks on top of the burning surface.

Then place wood platforms on top of the iron blocks to cross to victory.
en.hint_stage_5_1_1:
Find the material capable of conducting electricity, and use that as a wire for the wind machine.

Make use of the other materials to block the electricity, and as a platform to reach the goal.
